rules.summary: DPYD variants are used clinically to assess risk of fluoropyrimidine toxicity. This marker is one of several variants used in guidelines.

default_summary: No call or unrecognized genotype for DPYD markers.
suggestion: If you receive fluoropyrimidines (e.g., 5â€‘FU/capecitabine), discuss pharmacogenomic testing with a clinician. Do not change medications based on this app.

evidence_level.summary: CPIC guidelines exist for DPYD and fluoropyrimidines.

limitations: Many DPYD variants are rare and not captured by SNP chips. This is not a clinical test or dosing advice.
references: CPIC guidelines for DPYD and fluoropyrimidines (PharmGKB/CPIC)
